Package com.xebisco.yield

Interface PlatformGraphics

All Superinterfaces:
Disposable
All Known Implementing Classes:
SwingPlatform
public interface PlatformGraphics extends Disposable
The `PlatformGraphics` interface is a wrapper around the platform's graphics API. It's a simple class that provides a few functions for drawing to the screen

    Methods inherited from interface com.xebisco.yield.Disposable

    dispose

  • Method Details

    • init

      void init(PlatformInit platformInit)
      Initializes the platform graphics
      Parameters:
      platformInit - This is a struct that contains the parameters that will be used to init the graphics.

    • frame

      void frame()
      This function is called once per frame. This is the first function called in render, it's used to prepare the graphics for the incoming draw calls.

    • draw

      void draw(DrawInstruction drawInstruction)
      Draws the given draw instruction.
      Parameters:
      drawInstruction - A DrawInstruction object that contains all the information needed to draw the object.

    • resetRotation

      void resetRotation()
      Resets the graphics rotation.

    • shouldClose

      boolean shouldClose()
      Returns true if the user has requested that the application close.
      Returns:
      A boolean value.

    • conclude

      void conclude()
      This function is called once per frame. This is the last function called in render.

    • getCamera

      Vector2D getCamera()

    • setCamera

      void setCamera(Vector2D camera)
